info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 18 at 12:44PM CST by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of west central Calcasieu Parish, Jefferson, southwestern Newton, southeastern Hardin, Orange and southeastern Jasper Counties through 115 PM CST... At 1244 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Gist to near Nome. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Beaumont, Port Arthur, Orange, Nederland, Groves, Port Neches, Lumberton, Vidor, Bridge City, West Orange, Nome, Deweyville, Central Gardens, Hamshire, Mauriceville, Bevil Oaks, China, Rose City, Pine Forest and Lakeview. This includes Interstate 10 in Texas between mile markers 879 and 832. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
